Introduction to similarity of triangles

  1. Two triangles are similiar, if their corresponding angles are equal and their corresponding sides are in same ratio.
  2. If a line is drawn parallel to one side of a triangle to intersect the other two sides in distinct points, the other two sides are divided in the same ratio.
  3. The converse of the above theorem also true that says if a line divides any two sides of a triangle in the same ratio, then the line is parallel to the third side.
